12/6/2019.name: Dance Concert
12/6/2019.description:
Admission $6



The 2019 Winter Dance Concert, featuring the Mélange and Repertory Dance Companies and the Concert Dance class, is Friday and Saturday, Dec. 6-7 at 7 p.m. in the Performing Arts Center. Tickets are $6 and  can be purchased online  or at the door. The show features student choreography from Georgie Casaletto, Abbie Szwejbka, Elena Rouse, Jorie Knysz, Masha Khorolinsky, Magdalena Waz, Kiley Lacher, Heloise Jacobs, Leah Kochevar, Jocelyn Silk, Isabella Fontane, Ari Reinstein, Samantha Serpico, Juliette Koskela, Katie Wu, Allison Noronha,  Sammi Meyers, Hannah Stewart, and Chloe Lucido. Guest choreographers are Lauren Parets and Jordan Ryder.

12/13/2019.name: Hoops for Heroes/Military Appreciation Night
12/13/2019.description:
Bring items for care packages.  Here's what is needed .



Students Helping Soldiers and the SHS boys and girls basketball teams are joining forces to help Operation Wild Horse, as well as active members of the military. Students Helping Soldiers members will be collecting items at the Sports Center entrance for care packages that will be sent to military members during the holidays. These items will be accepted:

 * Powdered drink mix (Gatorade, lemonade, etc.)
* Protein bars
* Beef jerky snacks
* Candy (non-chocolate preferred)
* Chewing gum
* Travel-size toiletries
* Hand warmers

1/7/2020.name: Incoming Freshman Parent Night #1
1/7/2020.description:
Student last names A-H





Stevenson High School will hold orientation evenings for eighth-graders and their families in January.

Incoming freshman families will receive information regarding the online enrollment process, which must be completed for all soon-to-be freshman students by Jan. 31. Curriculum directors and students also will share information about course offerings and co-curricular activities.

Dates:
 * Tuesday, Jan. 7 (Student last names A-H)
* Thursday, Jan. 9 (Student last names I-P)
* Wednesday, Jan. 15 (Student last names Q-Z)
 
Times:
 * 6 p.m. - Information packet pick-up near the Performing Arts Center. Packets will include a password for online enrollment, 2020-21  Coursebook , 2020 summer school catalog, 2020-21 Co-Curricular Guide, and health forms.
* 6 p.m. - School tours will be available, starting at the Forum ("Point") entrance off parking lot B
* 7 p.m. - Presentation in the Performing Arts Center
 
Families unable to attend an Orientation Evening on their scheduled date may attend one of the other scheduled days. Families do not need to inform the school if they are attending on a different date.

Interpreters in Chinese, Hindi, Korean, Russian and Spanish will be available for these events. Families requiring an interpreter are asked to email Suzanne Paloian at  spaloian@d125.org  no later than Friday, Jan. 3.

Families with questions about the evenings or enrollment can contact Regina Anderson ( reanderson@d125.org  or  847-415-4502 ) or Suzanne Paloian ( spaloian@d125.org  or  847-415-4500 ).

1/14/2020.name: Building Balanced Teens
1/14/2020.description:
Learn how to help teens manage stress - without fixing their problems.







 Building Balanced Teens 
 Tuesday, Jan. 14, 7:30-8:30 a.m., District 125 Administration Center 
Everybody is busy these days, creating stress for the entire family. This session will address how to live a balanced life, how to manage stress, and how to help teens reset after a bad day - without fixing their problems.

1/23/2020.name: Incoming Freshman Course Selection Evening #1
1/23/2020.description:
Student last names A-L





Stevenson High School will hold course selection evenings for eighth-graders and their families in January.

Eighth-graders and their families will be able to meet individually with a school counselor for a brief conversation about freshman course choices. Student Services staff also will be available during these evenings to answer questions related to enrollment. Prior to the Course Selection Evenings (and after the Orientation Evenings earlier in January), families will receive a mailing from SHS sharing course recommendations for their child.

Dates:
 * Thursday, Jan. 23 (Student last names A-L)
* Tuesday, Jan. 28 (Student last names M-Z)
 
Time: 4-7 p.m.

Families unable to attend a Course Selection Evening on their scheduled date may attend the other scheduled day. Families do not need to inform the school if they are attending on a different date.

Interpreters in Chinese, Hindi, Korean, Russian and Spanish will be available for these events. Families requiring an interpreter are asked to email Suzanne Paloian at  spaloian@d125.org  no later than Friday, Jan. 3.

Families with questions about the evenings or enrollment can contact Regina Anderson ( reanderson@d125.org  or  847-415-4502 ) or Suzanne Paloian ( spaloian@d125.org  or  847-415-4500 ).

1/25/2020.name: Foundation Event: Happy Together
1/25/2020.description:
Tickets $25 per person. Group rates available.  Click here for details .





Married musical stars Michael and Angela Ingersoll hilariously share the spotlight singing oldies but goodies. He's the beloved star from  Jersey Boys  (original San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Chicago casts) and the PBS retro-rock group Under the Streetlamp. She's the Emmy nominee known for her astonishing portrayals of Judy Garland ( End of the Rainbow ;  Get Happy  on PBS). Enjoy Chicago Tribune's "Dynamic Power Couple" for shenanigans and signature songs including "Save the Last Dance For Me," "Over the Rainbow," and "I've Had the Time of My Life."

1/29/2020.name: Incoming Freshman Dance Auditions
1/29/2020.description:
For eighth-grade students with dance experience who would like to be considered for Dance 2, 3 or 4.  Click here to sign up .





Incoming Freshmen Assessment is for eighth-grade students with dance experience who would like to be considered for Dance 2, 3 or 4. The assessments are Wednesday and Thursday, Jan. 29-30, from 4:15-7:30 p.m. Attendance both days is required. Dancers should wear what they would wear at their studio for any technique class. Generally dancers wear: yoga/jazz pants, leggings, bootie shorts, or tights on the bottom and leotard or dance tank on top. Hair needs to be well secured off the face. No jewelry. Only bare feet or paws are acceptable. Wearing all black is   not   suggested. We often can decipher students by distinctive colors, hair items, etc. Please do not be extreme or purchase anything new. Just keep in mind we are trying to memorize 90 or so new faces. We also ask that dancers wash the clothing and wear it again on Thursday. This helps us to remember the students more accurately.

When arriving, please enter through parking lot E and proceed in through the Sports Center doors. The assessment will take place in Dance Studio (Room 2010). This is on the second floor behind the Sports Center. We request that you arrive right  after  3:45 p.m. because our school buses exit the lot at 3:45 p.m. each day and arriving during that process will be a traffic headache. Also, if you arrive prior to that, you will need to show photo ID at the security desk. 

We will begin check-in at 4 p.m. The assessment will begin around 4:15 p.m. The first day of the assessment can be very overwhelming. We do not add any new material the second day. Dancers perform back what they learned on Day 1. We will provide the titles of the music we have used so students have the option to practice. When dancers arrive home on Wednesday, encourage them to get a good night sleep and return for the second day. Eliminating oneself guarantees he/she will not be placed in an upper level class (Dance 2, 3 or 4), and should therefore register for Dance 1. Also, please remember no one is being cut from the program. We are simply trying to identify the best level for each dancer.

1/29/2020.name: Eating to Succeed
1/29/2020.description:
Featuring SHS alumnus Alex Stoller (Class of 2010).









"I exercise, so I can eat whatever I want." Does this sound familiar? While that may seem reasonable, it's not the whole story. In fact, what we eat impacts everything from our size to our behavior to our moods. Learn how to make smarter food choices for you and your family. Students-only session from 5:45-6:30 p.m.
The Parent Engagement Series program, "Eating to Succeed," will feature SHS alumnus Alex Stoller (Class of 2010).

1/30/2020.name: Freshman-Sophomore Play: Puffs
1/30/2020.description: The freshman-sophomore play features the Harry Potter parody, "Puffs, Or: Seven Increasingly Eventful Years at a Certain School of Magic and Magic," by Matt Cox. "For seven years a certain boy wizard went to a certain Wizard School and conquered evil. This, however, is not his story," reads the play's website. "This is the story of the Puffs ... who just happened to be there too. A tale for anyone who has never been destined to save the world."

2/6/2020.name: CPN Presents: Mindfulness for Parents
2/6/2020.description:
Sponsored by the Community Parent Network, a program of the Stevenson Foundation.



  
Mindfulness, or being present in the moment is necessary in parenting. Many parents' lives are rushed to the point that we are never fully here because we're always worrying about the next thing on the to-do list. We get stressed and anxious, easily provoked by our children into unhelpful reactions, instead of responding in a more considered way. Join Ramaa Krishna to learn how to slow down, and give space for some 'being' instead of always 'doing'. We will practice how to set aside a few minutes each day for mindfulness practice. As we allow mindfulness to seep into the rest of our daily life, we will find that we can approach parenting in a more mindful way.
  
  Registration requested at:

 https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mindfulness-for-paren...

2/11/2020.name: Dare Your Teen to Dream
2/11/2020.description:
Our Parent Engagement Series series continues with strategies to support your teens' hopes and dreams.




 Dare Your Teen to Dream 
 Tuesday, Feb. 11, 7:30-8:30 a.m., District 125 Administration Center 
Parents and guardians want to support their teens' hopes and dreams, even if they seem to change every day. This session will offer strategies to support self-discovery and navigate the perils of passion.

2/13/2020.name: ARTalk with Nadine "Yadi" Royster
2/13/2020.description:
Open to the public



Visiting Artist of the Month Nadine Royster will discuss her work and her career during the fourth ARTalks presentation of the 2019-20 school year. ARTalks is sponsored by the Stevenson High School Foundation and the SHS Fine Arts Division. This year's theme is "Celebrating Women Artists." To see more of her work, visit  www.yadiart.com .

The Visiting Artist Gallery is located on the first floor of the West Building, just south of the Forum (point) entrance. Use parking lot B for easiest access. ARTalks are free and open to the public.  Learn more about ARTalks and Stevenson's Visiting Artist of the Month program .

Understanding and managing stress is a critical component of parenting. When parents are stressed, so are their children. This session will offer tips on keeping stress in check for the whole family.

4/1/2020.name: Is It a Crisis, or Just a Problem?
4/1/2020.description:
Panel discussion on managing stress.







 Is It a Crisis, or Just a Problem? 
 Wednesday, April 1, 7-9 p.m., Vernon Area Public Library 
Not all stress is bad. Join us for a panel discussion about how parents can help their child navigate and manage stress and anxiety, and how to know when help is needed.

4/8/2020.name: AP Art and Adv. Photography Show
Journey to the Center of a Teen's Brain
4/8/2020.description:
Part of our Parent Engagement Series







 Journey to the Center of a Teen's Brain 
 Wednesday, April 8, 7-9 p.m., Recital Hall 
Participants will hear about mental health in the schools and the impact of social media on brain development. Find out what anxiety, depression, ADHD and autism look like in the brain, and what can parents do with this knowledge.
